trans-unit.source: Obtaining Network Server properties by using the getCurrentProperties method

seg-source.mrk: Obtaining Network Server properties by using the getCurrentProperties method

target.mrk: Obtaining Network Server properties by using the getCurrentProperties method

trans-unit.source: The <codeph>getCurrentProperties</codeph> method is a Java method that you can use to obtain information about the Network Server.

seg-source.mrk: The <codeph>getCurrentProperties</codeph> method is a Java method that you can use to obtain information about the Network Server.

target.mrk: The <codeph>getCurrentProperties</codeph> method is a Java method that you can use to obtain information about the Network Server.

trans-unit.source: It returns a <codeph>Properties</codeph> object with the value of all the Network Server properties as they are currently set.

seg-source.mrk: It returns a <codeph>Properties</codeph> object with the value of all the Network Server properties as they are currently set.

target.mrk: It returns a <codeph>Properties</codeph> object with the value of all the Network Server properties as they are currently set.

trans-unit.source: The signature of this method is:

seg-source.mrk: The signature of this method is:

target.mrk: The signature of this method is:

trans-unit.source: NetworkServerControl server = new NetworkServerControl(); Properties p = server.getCurrentProperties(); p.list(System.out); System.out.println(p.getProperty("derby.drda.host"));

seg-source.mrk: NetworkServerControl server = new NetworkServerControl(); Properties p = server.getCurrentProperties(); p.list(System.out); System.out.println(p.getProperty("derby.drda.host"));

target.mrk: NetworkServerControl server = new NetworkServerControl(); Properties p = server.getCurrentProperties(); p.list(System.out); System.out.println(p.getProperty("derby.drda.host"));

trans-unit.source: As shown in the previous example, you can look up the current properties and then work with individual properties if needed by using various APIs on the <codeph>Properties</codeph> class. You can also print out all the properties by using the <codeph>Properties.list</codeph> method.

seg-source.mrk: As shown in the previous example, you can look up the current properties and then work with individual properties if needed by using various APIs on the <codeph>Properties</codeph> class.
You can also print out all the properties by using the <codeph>Properties.list</codeph> method.

target.mrk: As shown in the previous example, you can look up the current properties and then work with individual properties if needed by using various APIs on the <codeph>Properties</codeph> class.
You can also print out all the properties by using the <codeph>Properties.list</codeph> method.
